{"step_by_step_thinking": "The auriculotemporal nerve is a branch of the mandibular nerve (V3), which is the third division of the trigeminal nerve. It gives off two roots that encircle the middle meningeal artery, a branch of the maxillary artery, which supplies the dura mater and parts of the calvaria.", "answer_choice": "D. Middle meningeal artery"}
